meanings.definition: A temporary protrusion of the protoplasm, as of certain protozoans, usually serving as an organ of locomotion or prehension.
meanings.sent1: The pseudopodium helped the tiny creature move around.
meanings.sent2: The amoeba extended its pseudopodium to reach for food.
meanings.sent3: The pseudopodium of the cell waved like a tiny arm.
meanings.sent4: The pseudopodium reached out like a tiny hand trying to grab something.
meanings.sent5: The pseudopodium acted like a flexible leg, propelling the organism forward.

meanings.definition: A temporary outgrowth of the body of a cell, as a phagocyte, in the direction of movement.
meanings.sent1: The phagocyte extended its pseudopodium to engulf the bacteria.
meanings.sent2: The cell's pseudopodium helped it move towards the target.
meanings.sent3: The pseudopodium of the cell wiggled playfully.
meanings.sent4: The pseudopodium of the cell reached out like a curious tentacle.
meanings.sent5: The pseudopodium of the cell was like a flexible arm reaching out for a hug.
